about.title: About Me
about.description: After working as a pharmacist in a full-time capacity for a number of years, I decided to pursue a career in coding. I am a dedicated and versatile full-stack web developer who specialises in Ruby on Rails and JavaScript. When I'm not staring at my computer screen, I spend my time playing the piano, listening to music, singing, going to pub trivia and making terrible puns.

jobs.title: Web Development Immersive
description: A rigorous three month course with a well rounded curriculum that teaches students how to build well-tested web applications

jobs.title: Full-stack Web Developer
description: A P2P car sharing platform that aims to improve community bonds and reduce carbon emissions. My coding skills dramatically improved while working there as I released features, fixed bugs, wrote tests, reviewed PRs and helped with deploys.

jobs.title: Senior Software Engineer
description: The quality assurance arm of the Royal College of Pathologists of Australasia, which offers accreditation to pathology labs in over 80 countries.

My responsibilities involve maintaining and expanding the features of the user interface. The interface consists of a Rails API and React app, which allows users to input data, view reports, as well as analyse results.

projects.title: Fpl App
description: A game based on the [Fantasy Premier League](https://fantasy.premierleague.com/). It allows users assemble a team of players from the English Premier League as they compete with other users in their league to score the most points based on their players' statistical performance.

Fpl App consists of a [Rails API backend](https://github.com/djstozza/fpl-app-api) and a [React frontend](https://github.com/djstozza/fpl-app-fe). The backend fetches data from the FPL API on a regular basis using workers powered by Redis and Sidekiq to update scores before notifying the frontend of the changes via Action Cable.

referenceLinks.name: Fantasy Premier League API Endpoints Guide

projects.title: Trump Tweet
description: Ever wondered what it would be like to be insulted on Twitter by the 45th President of the United States?

Trump Tweet is a Vue app with an Express server. It allows users to fill in a form by entering a name or Twitter handle into a text field and selecting a phrase i.e. Lyin' Ted or Crooked Hillary. Once the form is submitted, a call is made to a SearchBox ElasticSearch instance to obtain tweets that match the phrase. A random tweet is then selected and posted as a status update to [@hoaxDonalTrump](https://twitter.com/hoaxDonalTrump) with the name substitution.
